Comment:
Such an important distinction and one I see all the time when coaching biotech founders. Many approach investors as if they‚Äôre submitting a grant proposal focused on data, hypotheses, and long-term potential instead of communicating like business leaders.
Investors don‚Äôt fund exploration; they fund execution. What separates the ones who get a ‚Äúyes‚Äù is clarity, on how the science translates into value distribution, cost advantage, and scalability.
In my experience, the turning point often comes when founders start thinking like storytellers, not scientists. The story isn‚Äôt about what‚Äôs in the lab, it‚Äôs about how that science moves through the market and impacts lives. That‚Äôs when the conversation changes completely.
